definition.name: gh-action-pip-audit
definition.description: Use pip-audit to scan Python dependencies for known vulnerabilities
definition.author: William Woodruff <william@trailofbits.com>

inputs.name: summary
inputs.description: render a Markdown summary of the audit (default true)

inputs.name: no-deps
inputs.description: don't do any dependency resolution (requires fully pinned requirements) (default false)

inputs.name: vulnerability-service
inputs.description: the vulnerability service to use (PyPI or OSV, defaults to PyPI)

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.description: the inputs to audit, whitespace separated (defaults to current path)

inputs.name: virtual-environment
inputs.description: the virtual environment to audit within (default none)

inputs.name: local
inputs.description: for environmental audits, consider only packages marked local (default false)

inputs.name: index-url
inputs.description: the base URL for the PEP 503-compatible package index to use

inputs.name: extra-index-urls
inputs.description: extra PEP 503-compatible indexes to use, whitespace separated

inputs.name: ignore-vulns
inputs.description: vulnerabilities to explicitly exclude, if present (whitespace separated)

inputs.name: locked
inputs.description: audit lock files from the local Python project

inputs.name: internal-be-careful-allow-failure
inputs.description: don't fail the job if the audit fails (default false)

inputs.name: internal-be-careful-extra-flags
inputs.description: extra flags to be passed in to pip-audit

outputs.name: internal-be-careful-output
outputs.description: the column-formatted output from pip-audit, wrapped as base64
